title: &str slicing using SliceIndex is slow

labels.name: I-slow
labels.description: Problems and improvements with respect to performance of generated code.

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: T-libs-api
labels.description: Relevant to the library API team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
# Summary

It seems closure in unwrap_or_else doesn't inlined

https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/a25d58b41b273993c27a2533dc193b799abbf43f/src/libcore/str/mod.rs#L1854
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/a25d58b41b273993c27a2533dc193b799abbf43f/src/libcore/str/mod.rs#L1921
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/a25d58b41b273993c27a2533dc193b799abbf43f/src/libcore/str/mod.rs#L1986


I can't make PR because I don't know how can I fix should this code don't use `unwrap_or_else`? or need some patch for optimizer or LLVM?
# Godbolt

https://godbolt.org/z/TBhkjy


# Benchmark

## Code

https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=765da897030741f77b13ce397dc7f882

## Result
```
running 4 tests
test benches::bar_itself ... bench:         195 ns/iter (+/- 0) = 5261 MB/s
test benches::bar_long   ... bench:       2,311 ns/iter (+/- 14) = 5374 MB/s
test benches::foo_itself ... bench:         383 ns/iter (+/- 2) = 2678 MB/s
test benches::foo_long   ... bench:       4,606 ns/iter (+/- 7) = 2696 MB/s

test result: ok. 0 passed; 0 failed; 0 ignored; 4 measured; 0 filtered out
```
